name.en: Chair of Security and Theoretical Computer Science
Chair of Security and Theoretical Computer Science

description.et: Web, URL, HTTP protocol, HTTP headers, POST request, Browser Developer Tools, Crafting custom HTTP requests, HTTP cookies, Session cookies, Cookie attributes, Cookie override attacks, HTTP vs HTTPS, Secure cookies, SSL stripping attack, HTTP Strict-Transport-Security (HSTS)

Web security threat model, Same-Origin Policy (SOP), Same-Origin access, Tabnabbing attack, Fetch API, Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS), Cross-Site Leaks (XS-Leaks), Browser side-channel attacks, Framing restrictions, Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy (COOP)
CSRF vulnerability, GET vs POST requests, CSRF exploitation and impact, CSRF tokens, Referer-based validation, Fetch metadata request headers, SameSite cookies, Non-simple Fetch API requests

XSS vulnerability, Reflected XSS, Stored XSS, JavaScript code execution points, Session hijacking via XSS, HttpOnly cookies, Cookie jar overflow attack, XSS exploitation and impact, Encoding for different contexts (HTML, URL, JavaScript), Forbidden contexts
CSP, CSP nonce method, CSS injection, HTML-only attacks, Open redirect, Data exfiltration, Dangling markup injection, DOM clobbering
Clickjacking attack, GOTCHA attack, Address and address bar spoofing, Inception bar, Trustworthy UI, UI spoofing, Picture-in-Picture attack, Fullscreen attacks, User Activation, UI attacks

Password-based authentication, Password brute-force attack, Reverse brute-force attack, Password strength requirements, Password hashing, Rainbow table attack, Password reset, Username enumeration attack, Session fixation attack, Session management, Session termination and logout

Tracking, Tracking methods, Link decoration, Cookie-based tracking, DOM storage, HTTP cache, HSTS state, Browser session data clearing, Cross-site tracking, State partitioning, Private browsing, Fingerprinting, Fingerprinting vectors (system, UI, configuration, hardware, Canvas API / WebGL), Tor browser, Cookie banner

Rational database, SQL queries, SQL injection, SQL UNION operator, Database structure enumeration, Blind SQL injection, Batched queries, Timing side-channels, Escaping, SQL LIKE operator, Parameterized queries

Web bots, Crawlers, robots.txt, Googlebot spoofing, Web scrapper in Python, Browser automation, Bot detection, TLS client fingerprinting, JavaScript challenge, CAPTCHAs, User behavior analysis, Session replay scripts, User biometrics
Command injection, Code injection, Code inclusion, Directory traversal, File uploads, File upload vulnerabilities, Returning untrusted file content, MIME type sniffing, MIME confusion attack

Processing untrusted file data, XML entities, XML bomb, XML External Entity (XEE) attacks, Blind XXE attack, Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF), ZIP archive attacks, HTTP Parameter Pollution (HPP), Information disclosure, Session storage

Security event logging, Log injection and exhaustion attacks, Web Application Firewall (WAF), OWASP Core Rule Set (CRS), DDoS protection via CDN, Security testing, OWASP Application Security Verification Standard (ASVS), Pentesting, Bug bounty program, security.txt
